intro: Cuspidaria bracteata, commonly known as the bracted cuspidaria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist conditions, often in rocky or alpine environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and branched. The bracts, which are modified leaves, are prominent and often colorful, serving as a key identifying feature of the species.
